::English::
===========
Original Title: Carrie
Year: 1976
Country: United States
Director: Brian De Palma
Cast: Sissy Spacek, Piper Laurie, Amy Irving, John Travolta, Betty Buckley, Nancy Allen, PJ Soles, Priscilla Pointer.
Screenplay: Lawrence D. Cohen (on a novel of the same title by Stephen King
Music: Pino Donaggio
Photo: Mario Tossi
Company: United Artists
Duration: 98 minutes

Synopsis:
----------

A shy college girl with telekinetic powers named Carrie (Sissy Sapcek), intimidated by the surrounding society alienated because of the ultra religious education from his mother, is the subject of constant ridicule from classmates. On the eve of prom course will be invited by the most popular boy at school (William Katt).

Reviews:
----------
Adapting a novel by the prolific and successful horror Stephen King, Brian de Palma filmed one of his most celebrated. With a rise in crescendo, punctuated by the typical narrative of the principal, provides a history of terror and suspense of environment-familiar post-adolescent, culminating in a final act of absorbing. The single final shock will go down in horror film for its ability to surprise the viewer in a wise and gentle combination of image and music.

The best, the performances of Piper Laurie (companion of Paul Newman in "The Hustler") as Carrie's mother and Sissy Spacek as an extraordinary protagonist.
